GABA A receptors

GABA A receptors . Inhibitory ligand-gated ion channel. Site of action of most anaesthetic agents.

2α 2β 1γ subunits. Many different subtypes of each subunit (eg. α1 are sedative, α2 anxiolytic, and α3 myorelaxant).

Benzodiazepines bind to α subunits and increase frequency of channel opening. Barbiturates bind to β subunits and increase duration of opening.
